p: In order to determine the seroprevalence (specific IgG), a subgroup of 358 plasma samples (randomly taken from the previous group) was analyzed by ELISA. They corresponded to blood donations between epidemiological weeks 25 and 51 of year 2014 ( Figure 1) and the donor age range was 17–64 years (mean 35.0 ± 10.9, 95%CI 33.9–36.1); 289 (81%) were young adults (<45 years old, estimated population odds 4.2, 95%CI 3.2–5.4), and 192 (54%) were male (estimated population odds 1.2, 95%CI 0.9–1.4).
